post.description: Proxy for a GET request defined by an 'endpoint'. The request is authorized using a service connection. The response is filtered using an XPath/Json based selector.

dependencyInputIds.description: The ids of all inputs that the value of this input is dependent on.

description.description: Description of what this input is used for

groupName.description: The group localized name to which this input belongs and can be shown as a header for the container that will include all the inputs in the group.

hasDynamicValueInformation.description: If true, the value information for this input is dynamic and should be fetched when the value of dependency inputs change.

inputMode.description: Mode in which the value of this input should be entered

isConfidential.description: Gets whether this input is confidential, such as for a password or application key

name.description: Localized name which can be shown as a label for the subscription input

properties.description: Custom properties for the input which can be used by the service provider

type.description: Underlying data type for the input value. When this value is specified, InputMode, Validation and Values are optional.

useInDefaultDescription.description: Gets whether this input is included in the default generated action description.

validation.description: Information to use to validate this input's value

valueHint.description: A hint for input value. It can be used in the UI as the input placeholder.

values.description: Information about possible values for this input

systemConnection.description: Gets or sets the endpoint used for communicating back to the calling service.

id.description: Gets the id of the option.

createdOn.description: The date the package was created

downloadUrl.description: A direct link to download the package.

filename.description: The UI uses this to display instructions, i.e. "unzip MyAgent.zip"

hashValue.description: MD5 hash as a base64 string

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

authorization.description: Gets or sets the authorization data for talking to the endpoint.

createdBy.description: The Gets or sets Identity reference for the user who created the Service endpoint

description.description: Gets or Sets description of endpoint

id.description: Gets or sets the identifier of this endpoint.

name.description: Gets or sets the friendly name of the endpoint.

operationStatus.description: Error message during creation/deletion of endpoint

type.description: Gets or sets the type of the endpoint.

url.description: Gets or sets the url of the endpoint.

assignedRequest.description: Gets the request which is currently assigned to this agent.

authorization.description: Gets or sets the authorization information for this agent.

createdOn.description: Gets the date on which this agent was created.

maxParallelism.description: Gets or sets the maximum job parallelism allowed on this host.

statusChangedOn.description: Gets the date on which the last connectivity status change occurred.

authorizationUrl.description: Gets or sets the endpoint used to obtain access tokens from the configured token service.

clientId.description: Gets or sets the client identifier for this agent.

publicKey.description: Gets or sets the public key used to verify the identity of this agent.

body.description: Gets or sets the body of the message. If the IV property is provided the body will need to be decrypted using the TaskAgentSession.EncryptionKey value in addition to the IV.

iV.description: Gets or sets the intialization vector used to encrypt this message.

messageId.description: Gets or sets the message identifier.

messageType.description: Gets or sets the message type, describing the data contract found in TaskAgentMessage.Body.

administratorsGroup.description: Gets the administrators group for this agent pool.

autoProvision.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not a queue should be automatically provisioned for each project collection or not.

createdBy.description: Gets the identity who created this pool. The creator of the pool is automatically added into the administrators group for the pool on creation.

createdOn.description: Gets the date/time of the pool creation.

groupScopeId.description: Gets the scope identifier for groups/roles which are owned by this pool.

provisioned.description: Gets a value indicating whether or not roles have been provisioned for this pool.

serviceAccountsGroup.description: Gets the service accounts group for this agent pool.

size.description: Gets the current size of the pool.

isHosted.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not this pool is managed by the service.

poolType.description: Gets or sets the type of the pool

exponent.description: Gets or sets the exponent for the public key.

modulus.description: Gets or sets the modulus for the public key.

enabled.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not this agent should be enabled for job execution.

id.description: Gets the identifier of the agent.

name.description: Gets the name of the agent.

status.description: Gets the current connectivity status of the agent.

version.description: Gets the version of the agent.

agent.description: Gets or sets the agent which is the target of the session.

encryptionKey.description: Gets the key used to encrypt message traffic for this session.

ownerName.description: Gets or sets the owner name of this session. Generally this will be the machine of origination.

sessionId.description: Gets the unique identifier for this session.

encrypted.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the key value is encrypted. If this value is true, the property should be decrypted using the RSA key exchanged with the server during registration.

value.description: Gets or sets the symmetric key value.

connectionId.description: An ID that identifies a service connection to be used for authenticating endpoint requests.

keySelector.description: An Json based keyselector to filter response returned by fetching the endpoint Url.A Json based keyselector must be prefixed with "jsonpath:". KeySelector can be used to specify the filter to get the keys for the values specified with Selector.  The following keyselector defines an Json for extracting nodes named 'ServiceName'.  endpoint.KeySelector = "jsonpath://ServiceName";

scope.description: The scope as understood by Connected Services. Essentialy, a project-id for now.

selector.description: An XPath/Json based selector to filter response returned by fetching the endpoint Url. An XPath based selector must be prefixed with the string "xpath:". A Json based selector must be prefixed with "jsonpath:".  The following selector defines an XPath for extracting nodes named 'ServiceName'.  endpoint.Selector = "xpath://ServiceName";

taskId.description: TaskId that this endpoint belongs to.

execTask.description: The utility task to run.  Specifying this means that this task definition is simply a meta task to call another task. This is useful for tasks that call utility tasks like powershell and commandline

platformInstructions.description: If a task is going to run code, then this provides the type/script etc... information by platform. For example, it might look like. net45: { typeName: "Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Automation.Tasks.PowerShellTask", assemblyName: "Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Automation.Tasks.PowerShell.dll" } net20: { typeName: "Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Automation.Tasks.PowerShellTask", assemblyName: "Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Automation.Tasks.PowerShell.dll" } java: { jar: "powershelltask.tasks.automation.teamfoundation.microsoft.com", } node: { script: "powershellhost.js", }

type.description: Gets the name of the package.

url.description: Gets the url of the package.

version.description: Gets the version of the package.

api-Version.name: api-version
api-Version.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '3.2-preview' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.agentpools: Grants the ability to view tasks, pools, queues, agents, and currently running or recently completed jobs for agents
scopes.vso.agentpools_manage: Grants the ability to manage pools, queues, and agents

externalDocs.description: Visual Studio Team Services REST APIs
